container.heading: Adoption, Amendment, or Repeal of Regulations

para.text: Authority of Department. The Department may adopt, amend, or repeal regulations, on a regular or an emergency basis, as prescribed by the Administrative Procedure Act.
Notice and Opportunity for Comment. The Department shall:
Provide public notice of the proposed adoption, amendment, or repeal; and
Afford interested persons an opportunity to submit written data, views, or argument.
Hearing. The Department may hold a hearing on the proposed adoption, amendment, or repeal and afford interested persons the opportunity to:
Submit evidence; and
Make oral argument.

section.heading: Petition—Authorized.
section.text: Any interested person may petition the Department for the adoption, amendment, or repeal of any regulation.

para.text: Form. The petition shall be:
In writing; and
Filed with the Secretary.
Contents. The petition shall contain:
The petitioner's name, address, and telephone number;
The proposed regulation change; and
A brief statement of the reasons for the proposed change.
Notice of Receipt. On receipt of a petition, the Secretary shall promptly mail the petitioner a notice of filing, indicating the date the petition was received.
Consideration and Disposition. Within 60 days after the petition is submitted, the Secretary shall:
Consider the petition; and
Either:
Deny the petition and notify the petitioner in writing of the reasons for the denial; or
Initiate the procedures for adopting, amending, or repealing the regulation, and notify the petitioner in writing of this action.
